intro: Campanula telmessi, commonly known as the Telmessian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features showy blue to violet bell-shaped flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value and hardiness contribute to its popularity among gardeners and horticulturists.
